lib.chemical_potentials

Chemical potentials used in the defect modelling. It is important to keep in that zpe should be added without failure.

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_CrO2OH2(T, P=1, data=None)

Chemical potential of CrO2OH2 from formation Gibbs energies taken from free version of Factsage.

Parameters:

  • T (float) – Temperature in Kelvin

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure that defaults to ambient total pressure of 1 atm/Bar.

  • data (None) – Reinitialised to formation Gibbs free energies of CrO2OH2. Defaults to None for sphinx.

Returns:

Chemical potential of CrO2OH2

Return type:

float

Warning

ZPE of CrO3 will affect this chemical potential too.

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_CrO3(T, E_DFT_CrO3, P=1)

Chemical potential of CrO3 gas.

Parameters:

  • T (numpy array or float) – Temperature or temperature window in Kelvins

  • E_DFT_CrO3 (float) – CrO3 molecule energy in J/mol from DFT.

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure. Defaults to ambient total pressure of 1 atm/Bar

Returns:

Chemical potential of CrO3 gas.

Return type:

same type as T

Warning

ZPE of this molecule needs to be calculated.

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_H2(T, E_DFT_H2, P=1)

Chemical potential of hydrogen gas at reference condition.

Parameters:

  • T (float or numpy array) – Temperature or temperature window in Kelvins

  • E_DFT_O2 (float) – Hydrogen molecule energy in J/mol from DFT.

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure of the system. Defaults to ambient total pressure of 1 atm.

Returns:

chemical potential of hydrogen gas in J/mol with zpe included.

Return type:

same type as T

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_H2O(T, E_DFT_H2O, P=1)

Chemical potential of water vapour at reference condition.

Parameters:

  • T (float or numpy array) – Temperature or temperature window in Kelvins

  • E_DFT_O2 (float) – Water molecule energy in J/mol from DFT.

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure of the system. Defaults to ambient total pressure of 1 atm.

Returns:

chemical potential of water vapour in J/mol with zpe included.

Return type:

same type as T

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_O2(T, E_DFT_O2, P=1)

Chemical potential of oxygen gas at reference condition.

Parameters:

  • T (float or numpy array) – Temperature or temperature window in Kelvins

  • E_DFT_O2 (float) – Oxygen molecule energy in J/mol from DFT.

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure of the system. Defaults to ambient total pressure of 1 atm.

Returns:

chemical potential of oxygen gas in J/mol with zpe included.

Return type:

same type as T

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_SrO(T, E_DFT_SrO=-124209168.6541474, data=None, vib=0)

Chemical potential of SrO

Parameters:

  • T (float) – Temperature in Kelvin

  • E_DFT_SrO (float, optional) – Static lattice energy of SrO from DFT in J/mol

  • data (None) – Reinitialised with vibrational Helmholtz free energy in eV

  • vib (bool, optional) – Bool to include vibrational properties or not. Defaults to 0, to not include.

Returns:

Chemical potential of SrO

Return type:

float

lib.chemical_potentials.chem_pot_SrOH2(T, P=1, data=None)

Determinaton of SrOH2 chemical_potential from formation Gibbs free energies taken from free version of Factsage

Parameters:

  • T (float) – Temperature in Kelvin

  • P (float, optional) – Total pressure. Defaults to 1 ambient gas pressure

  • data (None) – Initialised to formation Gibbs free energy from factsage. Defaulted to none for sphinx.

Returns:

Chemical potential of SrOH2 in J/mol

Return type:

float

lib.chemical_potentials.linear_interpolator(x, x_data, y_data)

Function to interpolate data.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – x for which you want to determine y

  • x_data (numpy array) – data

  • y_data (numpy array) – data

Returns:

interpolated value

Return type:

float

Warning

This function cannot be moved to auxilliary functions due to circular imports. auxilliary modules imports this module to get some for surface_coverage. Maybe put surface coverage in hydroxylated_case and move this to auxilliary function for a neater structure.
